intro: Scabiosella, commonly known as meadow cranesbill, is a flowering plant belonging to the genus Scabiosa in the family Boraginaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive blue or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and woodland edges, preferring well-drained soils. Scabiosella has hairy stems and leaves, and its flowers are often clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences. It is a perennial herb that is relatively easy to cultivate in gardens with full sun to partial shade.
